data.name: Perfect Faro Shuffle
data.description:
# Perfect Faro Shuffle

A Faro Shuffle is a type of card shuffle in which the deck of cards is split perfectly in half, and each half is then perfectly shuffled with the other half.

`Deck                        Shuffled`  
`_____                          _____`  
`_____                       _____   `  
`_____     Left    Right        _____`  
`_____ --> _____   _____ --> _____   `  
`_____     _____   _____        _____`  
`_____     _____   _____     _____   `  

## Your Task:

You will be given an array of strings representing cards, and your task is to perform a Faro Shuffle and return the shuffled cards. If the number of cards is odd, the left half gets the extra card.

## Example:

Given the array of cards `["QH","JS","JC","2D","5H","5C","7D","8S","9S"]`

Split the deck into two halves:  
Left half: `["QH","JS","JC","2D","5H"]`  
Right half: `["5C","7D","8S","9S"]`  

Start adding cards from alternating halves, starting with the left half:  
`["5H"]`  
`["9S","5H"]`  
`["2D","9S","5H"]`  
`["8S","2D","9S","5H"]`  
...  
`["QH","5C","JS","7D","JC","8S","2D","9S","5H"]`  

And finally return the shuffled deck.

## Notes:

- If there is an odd number of cards, the left half gets the extra card.
- Start adding cards from the left half first.
